snippet: In an election focused on the economy, the votes from the legions of unmarried women who helped lift President Obama to victory in 2008 are now up for grabs.
abstract: Legions of unmarried women, worried over the economy, are increasingly undecided on who they will vote for in the upcoming election, despite having voted primarily Democratic in years past; Pres Obama's and Mitt Romney's presidential campaigns are lavishing attention on single women voters, who are becoming one of the country's fastest-growing demographic groups.

byline.contributor: Robert Gebeloff contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: In an election focused on the economy, the votes from the legions of unmarried women who helped lift President Obama to victory in 2008 are now up for grabs.

headline.seo: In Weak Economy, an Opening to Court Votes of Single Women
headline.main: In Weak Economy, an Opening to Court Votes of Single Women
headline.print_headline: In Weak Economy, an Opening to Court Votes of Single Women
